name: 3,5-bis(trifluoromethyl)phenylacetic acid
Reason: 3,5-Bis(trifluoromethyl)phenylacetic acid has a melting point influenced by its functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces significant rigidity and molecular weight, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. The phenyl group contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The carboxy group introduces a hydroxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The presence of two methoxy groups can also contribute to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +5°C per group, totaling +10°C.
